title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4043 - Drugs Prohibited and Other Prohibitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4043 - Drugs Prohibited and Other Prohibitions

State Regulations
§ 4043.1 - Definitions
§ 4043.2 - Restricted use of drugs, medications and other substances
§ 4043.3 - Equine drug thresholds; per se
§ 4043.4 - Trainer's responsibility
§ 4043.5 - Disqualification
§ 4043.6 - Erythropoietin and darbepoetin
§ 4043.7 - Reserpine and fluphenazine
§ 4043.8 - TCO2 blood gas testing program
§ 4043.9 - Pre-race detention
§ 4043.10 - TCO2 testing: punishment for failure to cooperate
§ 4043.11 - Use and disposal of hypodermic syringes and needles
§ 4043.12 - Prohibited substances and methods
§ 4043.13 - Other prohibitions
§ 4043.14 - Restrictions on shock or pulse wave therapy
§ 4043.15 - Anabolic steroids
§ 4043.16 - No drug administrations without appropriate veterinary approval
§ 4043.17 - Exercise Induced Pulmonary Hemorrhage (EIPH)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, subtit. T, ch. I, subch. A, art. 1, pt. 4043

Statutory authority: Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and

Breeding Law, §§ 101, 104[1], [19], 128, 207, 227, 301, 305, 401, 405, 902; Unconsolidated Laws, §
8162[1]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
